hints.content: Start by understanding what a pair sum is. For any two numbers `a` and `b`, the pair sum is simply `a + b`. Your goal is to minimize the maximum of these sums when pairing elements from the array.

Consider the properties of the array. Since the length of the array is even, you will always be able to form `n/2` pairs. Think about how the values in the array can be combined to achieve the desired outcome.
To minimize the maximum pair sum, think about how pairing larger numbers with smaller numbers might help. This could balance out the sums across pairs.
Try sorting the array first. Once sorted, consider how you might pair the smallest available number with the largest available number. This could lead to a more balanced distribution of sums.
After sorting, you can visualize pairing elements from the two ends of the array. For example, if `nums` is sorted, you might pair `nums[0]` with `nums[n-1]`, `nums[1]` with `nums[n-2]`, and so on.
As you form pairs, calculate the sums for each pair. Keep track of the maximum sum you encounter. This will help you find the minimized maximum pair sum.
Remember to iterate through the pairs carefully. You will need to ensure that each element is used exactly once and that you are considering all pairs formed.
Think about edge cases, such as when all elements are the same or when they are in a strictly increasing or decreasing order. How would your approach handle these scenarios?
Once you have your pairs and their sums, the final step is to return the maximum of these sums. Make sure your logic correctly identifies the maximum pair sum from your computed sums.
To finalize your approach, implement the sorting, pairing, and maximum sum calculation in a single function. Make sure to test with various input cases to validate your solution.

questionNotes: The input array length is guaranteed to be even.
Each element in the array is unique and lies between 1 and 100,000.
The output should be a single integer representing the minimized maximum pair sum.
